name: Taj Rambagh Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time staying with Taj and I had the most amazing experience ever. My Husband and I planned a tour of Delhi/Rajastan with stays in different Taj hotels. The Taj hotel chain went above and beyond and helped plan our tour and when we had to cancel a few stays there was no problem. The only problem we had was cancelling the hotel stay we had booked through expedia (another story). We were picked up from the Airport, went on a horse and carriage tour, had the most amazing moon and candlelight dinners and some of the rooms we had mad us feel like we were royalty. Totally recommend Taj hotels and we are dying to go back soon.
reviews.title: Love Taj

likes.liked: — How breathtakingly beautiful it was at night when the sun was setting, candles and dancers entertaining us during dinner and drinks.
likes.disliked: — nothing to dislike...wish i could live here :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have traveled all over the world and stayed in incredible hotels, but the Rambagh is by far the best hotel I have stayed in. The setting, the staff, the food,the room, everything was perfection. We came for a special birthday and the hotel knocked themselves out making sure it was special. This is a rare hotel where the employees are not just polite and helpful, they actually care if the guests are enjoying themselves.The dining staff is over the top. They are wonderful people and true examples of Indian hospitality. Perhaps they will come over to the US and train some of our people?? I hope I am privileged enough to return.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel. It is, of course, very expensive, but we were on our honeymoon and spared no expense. You feel like a maharaja staying here.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — It is in Jaipur, which is a dump of a city

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: it was the first time i visited rambag.....i just loved the atmosphere....great sevices....excellent food.... in all i enjoyed my visit and i m sure would like the visit again and again.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006
reviews.text: Pure excitement filled as we arrived at this grand palace. Upon arrival we were greeted with a tilk (red dot) on the forehead and a garland of flowers. One of the best luxury hotels in the Taj group hotel chain within India.
reviews.title: Amazing setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of years back my husband and I took a trip of India staying mainly in the Taj and Oberoi hotels.
reviews.title: A class of its own

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In Jaipur we decided to stay at the Rambaugh Palace as it was highly recommended by our friends who stayed here a year earlier.
reviews.title: Stay for the History

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is amazing in all areas, its in a class of its own and is a must if your staying in Jaipur.
reviews.title: A Royal experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a good choice, if not the only, for staying at a luxury property in Jaipur. It is about 10 minutes drive to the historic city center and its attractions. The grounds are vast and lovely to walk around.
reviews.title: Awesome experience .. A must visit ..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rambagh was the palace of Jaiupr's last Maharajah and has an interesting history behind it. It is quite large and there are many rooms and suites offering different view points. Ours was on the first floor around the interior courtyard and was quite large. There are a few restaurants and having a meal studying the amazing structures/details is an experience on its own. If possible, try to have diinner at the signature Indian restaurant, Suvarna Mahal. You'll eat in the Grand Dining Hall of Palace and the food is great too. Service at the restaurants is slow and sometimes not very attentive. Try to enjoy the atmosphere instead of getting upset.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel, excellent service and great food!!
Excellent services by Taj
reviews.text: very good hotel & services are exccellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We visited the Taj Rambagh whilst stopping over for a night in Jaipur during our honeymoon through India, and we regret not having booked in two nights instead of just the one.
reviews.title: Probably the best Taj in India

likes.liked: — It's really as if you're staying in a palace!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel took our breath away from the very entrance, and stepping into the reception just took you into a different realm.
reviews.title: The best in Jaipur

likes.liked: — The room and the feeling of peace and calm in the middle of Jaipur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was honestly as if being maharaja's ourselves! The staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly, and check-in was done extremely expeditiously.
reviews.title: lovely hotel and grounds but must upgrade the rooms

likes.disliked: — room decor , and poor management to sort out problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were led to our room, through the interior of the palace, and ended up in what turned out to be the largest hotel room we stayed in out of all the places we visited and stayed. The furnishings were very lush, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and bathroom was plentiful with amenities.
reviews.title: One of the world's best hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: We felt like sultans, staying in this former Jaipur royal palace. The breathtakingly beautiful courtyards and grounds, and period-decorated but fully comfortable, large rooms provide the setting. The staff completes the picture, from the groundskeepers with flags prowling the courtyards to shoo pigeons away to the folks in the hallways who are always willing to drop what they are doing to show you to a destination.
reviews.title: Live like a sultan

likes.disliked: — Food did not measure up to the rest of the property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the food did not match up to the rest of the experience. The buffet breakfast selection was rather limited, perhaps because they are happy to serve you from the menu. The dinner cuisine in the Indian dining room seemed dumbed down for foreign tastes, except for the dish billed as the hottest, which was indeed hot but otherwise flavorless.
reviews.title: Magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed the shops at the hotel . Although they weren't cheap, they were not as exorbitantly priced as we would have expected, especially after hard bargaining produced discounts of 40% or so.
reviews.title: Refined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in many beautiful hotels during our 2-week trip to Northern India but this may have been the most spectacular. We were upgraded (without asking) to a magnificent historical suite. Every furnishing in the suite was a work of art but we did not feel as if we were in a museum. The grounds are extremely attractive, including the spas and pools, and the staff is extremely solicitous. We enjoyed visiting Steam, the railroad car bar, and wished we had had time to sample the flat-crust Italian pizza. A 2-night stay was not enough at this gorgeous hotel!
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a truly beautiful hotel - that has a strong sense of the Raj and colonial India combined. The staff are very helpful, the service excellent, the buffet breakfast diverse and a wide selection of exotic fruits.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel, with fabulous grounds and amenities - do not miss it if you have the means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities are what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The evening performance on the lawn with traditional dancers, is spectacular.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Th biggest disappointment was the beds - they do not live up to a 5 star hotel standard. They are amongst the hardest/firmest beds we have ever slept on and do not allow one the benefit of a luxurious sleep. The pillows were also sub-standard for a hotel of this nature. The hotel culd look at reviewing it 's bedding! Ouch..
reviews.title: Best Rajasthani hospitality - with breathtaking atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Expect to pay premium prices for bar drinks, dinner and all add-ons. The experience is well-worth it, if you are looking for indulgence - you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Rose Petal Bubble Bath!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This experience is one of those experiences you tell everyone is not possible to explain in words. It must be individually experienced to understand.
reviews.title: A real palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a real palace...functioning as a real palace until the late 1950's. It still has the feel of a palace, even if it has become a little commercialized. As we understood, the original royal family still owns the property and seeks to cover their ownership costs by licensing it to a hotel management company. This provides for a situation that is both the positive and the negative. Obvious care is taken to truly care about the property...everything is well maintained and manicured. But, it also means many available corners are generating revenue, including shops in the hotel and garages converted to tourist offices, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.liked: — It's a beautiful, really well run hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff is among the best of any hotels we have ever stayed in...
reviews.title: Nicest Hotel we have ever stayed in...

likes.liked: — The well appointed room, the food in the Indian restaurant
likes.disliked: — No negative comments to make about this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: obviously long time veterans of this hotel who have not lost any of their desire to serve the guests in the most attentive manner possible.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We often stay in other five star properties, including Aman properties and Four Seasons. We were suitably pleased that this hotel cost less, but in our opinion, was a superior experience to the better hotels/resorts world wide.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was suppose to be here last Oct for the Pushkar camel fair but had to cancel because of meetings, so since I couldn't cancel my room, moved the stay to the last weekend instead.
reviews.title: great service: the Rambagh staff = the real gems here in Jaipur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: this was my 3rd time in Jaipur (and coming back this Easter with friends), after a stressful transit from Delhi to Jaipur due to cancelled flights (jet air cancelled vs. a simple delay, I ended up on Kingfisher) the moment I arrived at the Jaipur airport & saw the Rambagh hotel associate and driver my heartrate slowed down and was happy & relaxed since, @ least until I had to deal with the Jaipur/delhi/ hong kong transit again (thought 4 hours was plenty to transit between Delhi domestic & Delhi int'l... ugh, 4 hours was not, I barely made my flight! )
reviews.title: Loved the Harry

likes.liked: — ITS LOCATION AND THE SERVICE PROVIDED BY THEM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what I liked about Rambagh
reviews.title: I almost cried when we left, it was SO good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) every staff knows you by name, very quickly
reviews.title: My best holiday till date

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 2) you are treated like a royal, from the moment you arrive @ the airport/ and the hotel
reviews.title: Majestic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It simply does not get better than this. On check in we were upgraded to one of the Royal Suites and we were in heaven from there on.
reviews.title: Rambagh Palace - Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: What a fantastic stay!
nice service
reviews.text: The room was plain superb. Very spacious and very nicely furnished.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The surroundings are just marvelous with both the interiour court-yard and the surrounding gardens being absolutely gorgeus
reviews.title: feeling like a princess at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife was very pleased with the Spa which was one of the best ones she has ever been to.
reviews.title: A Magical place

description: Walk from room to room amongst rich textures, opulent furnishings and exquisite objects d'art. Step out into expansive, ornamental gardens arranged in brilliant symmetry. Retire to rooms that were once the sanctuaries of kings, princes and their guests. Rambagh Palace exudes an unmistakable sense of history. It's an architectural masterpiece that transcends time. Request the legendary Peacock suite, which overlooks the Mughal Terrace and the garden where the Maharaja used to celebrate "Holi," the festival of color and lights. Stage an evening of high romance in a private tent, illuminated only by torchlight. Indulge in a stately dining at the gilded Suvarna Mahal, formerly the palace ballroom. Enjoy a royal, feast and lounging under a star-speckled sky. Play Polo as the kings played it, or at a more leisurely pace on elephant back. Wind up the day's activities in the sophisticated charm of the legendary Polo Bar. Rambagh Palace allows guest to partake of a wealth of experiences that resound with the memories, luxuries and extravagances of a bygone era that luckily, has not entirely disappeared.
